intro: Aster plantaginifolius, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its showy purple to pink flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy addition to gardens.
